alert.note: Alert for Anderson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 12:22AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Anderson County through 1245 AM CDT... At 1221 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kincaid, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kincaid. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for east central Kansas.
